page.title: 05Dancer's Grave
page.content:
Tales of Highway men are very popular. Robbing coaches began in the 17th century in the reign of Charles II.Some robbers could not afford a horse so they robbed on foot. They were called {Footpads}. Highway robbery became so common that the robbers would advertise which coaches they were to rob, when they were going to rob them and how much they expected to gain.
An extremely ruthless robber in North Bucks was Dancer. He evaded arrest for several years but was eventually caught and hanged at the crossroads north of Singleborough to ensure maximum publicity. Today this place is known as Dancer's Grave.
